attributes.action: stop the closure of Hoddesdon Open Air Swimming Pool
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: HOAP is a council owned pool in the Borough of Broxbourne.  It is usually open between May and September.  Broxbourne Council claims (falsely) that it cannot find £60,000 to open the pool this year.  This money could have been claimed through the Government Free Swimming Initiative as could a grant to renovate the 70 year old pool.  The council did neither.  Yet the borough is in the Lea Valley with its many lakes and water courses.  6 primary schools and 2 swimming clubs used the pool for lessons.  The Amateur Swimming Association says that the borough is 'under-pooled' having 2 over-subscribed public indoor pools for 87,000 residents.  With rising obesity, it is essential to provide opportunities for all to exercise.  HOAP is a honey-pot in the holidays for children, who enjoy hours of healthy recreation there.  1000 people signed a petition, to keep the pool open, which was presented to the council on 24 Feb 09.  This was dismissed.
